text: Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

This a DIY version, using the two cans to make a black and tan. It may have slightly more Yang (IPA) than Yin (Stout).

I tried to do the layering with the spoon but I dont have the right type of spoon so it never works out well. Blended, it is a dark, dark brown, nearly black.

Aroma isnt that strong, but 

Taste is chalky mocha coffee with a lovely piney finish on top. It is malt-forward but also not devoid of hop. The malts are burnt cookies. The malt comes out strong at the top, but later on, the hops take over, coating the palate with a very strong woody finish.

The feel is kind of sandpapery, smooth but also with a gritty texture. Its really a kind of wonderful beer, balancing the sweets and the bitters of both beers really well. Its an incredibly difficult dance but Yin/Yang does it right.

At Dans. Now Yin in its own right was great, but possibly a little too carbonated. Yang also great, possibly a little too sweet maybe. But Yin and Yang at one third / two thirds has created something even more special and the combination works so well. Deliciously smooth, with softer carbonation, and balanced sweetness. Lovely!

Oneness from duality. Giant hop monster makes sweet love to a delicious impy stout. Serenity in a pint glass. Good beer, in other words. Beautiful pour, dark and mysterious with a mighty head and voluminous lace. Aroma leans mostly stout, chocolate and coffee backed by light pine. Taste starts with a bold mocha sweetness, milk chocolate and espresso, with a growing bitter streak laced with pecan and pine and orange. Anise and raisin on the finish. No alcohol present despite the 10% ABV. Wonderful brew. Cant wait to try to the individual parts.

bottle @ home
clear dark brown blach, brown head with lacing
milk chocolate, porto, light burned wood, marshmellow
complex and full feeling, burned wood, light smoke, cocoa, vanilla, alcohol, caramel, dry bitter hoppy ending

Pours deep brown with a large soft tan head. Aroma is somewhat citrusy with dark chocolate. Definitely more citrusy than chocolate. Flavor is dark chocolate, bitter citrus peel, peat, perhaps a bit of pine. Tasty!
Хорошее, интерес& пиво. И еще раз что бы было 75 символо& Хорошее, интерес& пиво.

Una Black IPA de color café oscuro y baja carbonatacion y espuma. Su aroma es a café con toques frutales de Damasco y durazno. Su sabor es cremoso, donde reinan en una mezcla precisa un suave, pero persistente sabor a café con el típico amargor de la IPA con sus toques frutales a durazno, hierbas y un suave dulzor a miel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottles. Home blend with recommended percentages. Dark brown color with ruby highlights near the edge. light carbonation. tan head. Chocolatey aroma, some spice and herbs from the hops. Flavor is still fairly roasty but not overly so. Spice from the hops, restrained bitterness through the finish. Not bad!

Sehr angenehmes röstiges Aroma mit Anklängen von Rosinen, Likör und Rumtopf. Geschmack leider sehr alkoholisch, aber ansonsten schön rund mit Karamell, Rosinen und Schokolade. Gut geeignet als Dessert-Bier.
Schwarz. Röstiger Geruch, auch nach Trockenobst. Im Geschmack restsüß, mit Beerenaromen. Im Nachgeschmack dann nachhängende Bittere. Alkoholisch.
1+1 is less than 2 in this case. Black IPA-ish with a bit more complex roasted middle, medium grapefruit bitterness with roast, sharp.

Bottle from Bierkompass!

Pours deep black with a small head. Aroma of strong espresso and slight fruity hops. Taste has creamy coffee notes, lots of bitter chocolate and slight tropical fruits. Very roasty finish!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with medium sized beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, caramel and some hops. Taste has coffee, some fruitiness and malts. Quite interesting mix of flavors but overall this is a nice beer.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Black & Tan - mix of two beers. Both Yin and Yang are very present in this one, though I feel that the "dark" notes are dominant.

Beautiful sweet prune syrupy aroma. Very dark off black color with tan shimmering head. Beautifully balanced black and tan. Rich sweet start with a poppin light side tongue action to finish. Amazing!

Tap @ Beer Temple, sample size. Black color. Beige head with good retention and lacing. Aromas: roast, tar, some resin. Retronasal its sweetish, roasty, vanilla. Flavor is moderate sweet with light bitterness. Medium bodied. Finishes with more tar, roast, bitter.
Отличне& пиво. Аромат бесподо& Америка& хмели во всей красе. Лучшее сочетан& светлог& и тёмного пива в мире.

12oz bottle from Sonoma Cellars in Oconomowoc. Black pour with a beige-brown head leaving little lacing. Aroma has caramel and espresso and something herbal. Taste is of sweet caramel, bittersweet chocolate, some bitter coffee flavors, some saltiness. Medium bodied with a touch of alcohol. The blend is ok. The carbonation is soft. Finishes to the bitter side of bittersweet. Not sure if this is old but there is little hop presence if any. Suspect there are a bunch of dead hops floating around in this one. 13.3

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Opaque, but clear around the edges, mahogany with a creamy 1-finger tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, citrus, chocolate and coffee.

Taste of chocolate, roasted malt, citrus, roasted coffee and caramel with a little spiciness in the finish. 

Full/medium body and medium carbonation with a rich, silky mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap at Taphouse. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, hops, bitterness, alcohol, dried fruit and licorice.

Kicsi, nem túl tartós hab, fekete szín. Pohárba töltéskor black ipás, később inkább porteres-stoutos jegyeket mutató illat.Enyhén édeskés, pörkölt malátás, fekete csokis ízvilág, komoly komlós fűszerességgel, hosszú lecsengéssel. Testes, közepesen keserű, enyhén szénsavas. Finom, jól összehangolt sör.

Sample at B spot, Auburn Hills. Pours dark, tan head. Aroma is lots of roasted malt, some hoppy citrus, minimal coffee and chocolate. Flavor is roasted malt, chocolate, citrus. Drinks more like a really hoppy Stout, but I guess youd still call it black ipa territory. Medium mouthfeel. Decent. Doesnt blow my mind.

Rating #2153 - 1/3 Yin and 2/3 Yang in bottle. 2015.11.05 - Willow Park Beer Bash. Pours a thuggy twin brother waiting in the alley black with a bubbly tan head. Aroma is a violent clash between toasted malt, and floral piney hops. Taste is extremely hoppy, tempered with a pleasant coffee, chocolate, burnt sugar sweetness that disguises any alcohol on the palate and rounds out the earthy bitterness, and is beyond refreshing. Unreal hoppy black beauty.

the aroma is caramel and hoppy with shades of nuts, toast, pine, citrus and spicy herbs... the taste is caramel and spicy with notes of roasted malt, bitter citrus, pine needles, nuts and spicy grasses... bitter and dry aftertaste...

Bottle into wine glass. Sometimes I manage to really enjoy these BIPAs. This time wasnt really one of them. Nice viscosity but just too much hops bitterness and hops to balance the dark side of it. Imo.

Zwart bier met fijne crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Zoet caramelachtig aroma. Mooi zacht van smaak (drop, mout, bitter). Lange bittere afdronk. De Yang heeft in deze duidelijk de bovenhand boven de Yin maar het is toch een heel lekker bier geworden.

From Saveur-Biere. In Teku glass. Watching Los Soprano 1x08. DIPA in nose, soft IS in mouth at beginning and end of sip, hoppy in the middle. Much more drinkable than their separate parts, alcohol unnoticeable

Draft. Pours a medium thick, light beige, rapidly collapsing head, with minimal lacing, over a clear dark brown (SRM 30) body......nose is roasted malts with chocolate, coffee notes, mild herbal hops, malts dominant......taste is roasted malts with chocolate, coffee notes, mild hints of dried fruits, hints of molasses, burnt sugar, light spice tones, finishing with lingering mild hop bitterness......mouth feel, medium body, creamy, moderate alcohol warmth, high carbonation. This is an interesting beer with minimal Imperial Stout characteristics, except for the dark malts, with no dried fruits, and the hops are relatively hidden throughout. It misses the Black IPA style, as it is muddled and not particularly clean. BJCP 7/3/12/4/6
Perfect combination, love the duo more than the singles. Would drink them always together..

Dark brown color. Roasted malt aromas with hops being more noticeable the longer you sniff it. Floral and hay. Taste has toasted malt, some licorice and hops. The beer is supposedly a mix of an Imperial Stout and an IPA, but the result is so close to a Black IPA that I would never have guessed it.

The aroma is fruity, coffee and chocolate. The taste is quite similar. A little fruitiness and more coffee. Okay bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth forever. I do not really like the mix in this beer. I am not impressed with this beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Aroma of coffee, grapefruit, chocolate and blood orange. Pours black with a tan head. Bitter and sweet taste. Grapefruit, vanilla, dark chocolate and coffee taste. Wow. Full bodied, average carbonation, bitter and long finish. Amazing beer.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2016 (Bottle) Dark brown colour with frothy, beige head. Roasted, hoppy nose with black coffee, liquorice, black rye bread, dried fruit, some pine needles and a touch of mint. Roasted, malty taste with notes of black coffee, black rye bread, dark fruit, treacle toffee, hints of tar and a generous piney, slightly minty, bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a slight sweetness. Tasty and well balanced with a generous hop profile. Hides its alcohol level deceptively well. Very nice.
Bottle. Color is dark red brown. Head is medium and beige. Body is medium. Taste is medium sweet and bitter. Finish is long and medium dry. Aroma is roasted, hops, liquorice, malt, chocolate.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2016 On tap at Beertemple. Pitch black with a nice tan head. Brewed coffee, pine resin, soft chocolate, roasted coffee beans, cocoa, sone grapefruit. Smooth mouthfeel. A bit alcoholic toward the end.

0,33l bottle. Beutiful black colour with lasting small beige head. Aroma: Intense honey, nuts, berry fruits, winey. Very fine. Taste: Oh my god. Sweet malty start than a serious bitter mouthfeel. Very tasty soul warming. A lot of nuts in the taste. Very smooth texture. Full body with smooth carbonation. Long bitter/a bit sour and dry finish. Amazing big beer.

Appearance- utterly pitch black, a small beige head which quickly settled into a thin film. Aroma- plenty of fudgy chocolate, coffee, dark malt, caramel, hoppy and fruity undertones, chocolate orange, hints of vanilla sweetness, toffee-covered fruitcake. Taste- lots of bitter chocolate, orange peel, chocolate orange, overdone fruitcake, roasted malts, black coffee, undertones of Christmas cake. Hoppy bitter finish. Becomes more fruity and bitter with warmth. Smooth and full mouthfeel, alcohol very well hidden. Nicely blended, doesnt seem like 10%.

The aroma is full of hops, chocolate, coffee, pine, citrus, flowers and peaches. The color is pitch black. The taste is full of hops, chocolate, coffee, pine, flowers, mango, peaches, passionfruit and pineapple. A really nice black IPA!

Svart med litet ljusbrunt skum. Stor rostade toner, främst kaffe, i doften men även lite citrus. I smaken kommer först kaffe och lakrits, sedan kommer lite citrus och tallbarr och därefter en rejäl lakritsbeska. En riktigt välbalanserad black IPA.

330ml bottle from Beervana. Pours a deep black color with a medium light brown head that diminishes into a small film that lingers. Aroma is amazingly intense, a battle between the hops and the roasted malts without a clear winner. Huge hoppy notes of grapefruit, mango, citrus, pine and tangelo, battling the charry, licorice, molasses and dark espresso from the roasted grains. The "middle of the road" that summarizes the smell is a black olive character. Taste is bitter from two different angles, strong green/orange hoppy flavors and dark roasted coffee-ish notes. The result is a blend of incredible intensity. Ripe and rich flavors overwhelm the tastebuds. Delicious. Body is big and bold. Alcohol presence is well-concealed although the warming effect contributes nicely to the feeling of immensity. Low carbonation. I do not rate it higher because I feel its an ejoyable tour-de-force but not a highly refined brew.

Keg at Brewdog Manchester. Pours very dark brown, brown head. Nose is roast, sweet dsrk malts, piney hops. Taste is hoppy fruity, pine, roast, bitter roasty and warming finish. Strong, bitter and fruity bipa.
Really well balanced BIPA. Just the right amount of roasted, sweet sticky malts and piney, tropical hops. One of the best Ive had. Delicious.

Bottle from andersons. Nose is coffee and smoke with bit of hop. Blackish and taste matches. Malt and cocoa and dark sugars linger in with the hop acridity. Would've done more stout to Ipa ratio but pretty good.

Wyjątkowo udany blend. W aromacie o dziwo nad risem dominuje ipa, słodkie mango, dopiero w tle czekoladowa pełnia. Nie lubię owocowych black ipa, ale tu to gra! W smaku już więcej imperialnego stoutu, pojawia się czekolada, pralinka i lekka paloność, choć chmiele nie dają odporu, znów soczyste słodkie mango, goryczka raczej stonowana. Black IPA bez słonecznika. Aha, nie uwierzę że to ma tyle ABV, mega zdradliwe. Fajne!

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Malty alcohol with some spruce hoppiness.
Adjunct: The aroma is rye and malt.
Best black and tan Ive ever had, but then its an IIPA and Imp. Stout mix.

0.15 l on tap at Craft & Draft. Very dark brown to black with a thin, light brown head. Sweetish, roasty and fruity aroma of dark chocolate, coffee and tropical fruits. Sweetish-malty, roasty and fruity taste of dark chocolate, coffee, tropical fruits and some licorice, followed by a medium long, roasty-bitter, slightly resiny finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Good!
Bottle at home. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is chocolate, citrus, slight roasty. Taste is chocolate sweetness, roasted malts, caramel, piney, hop kick, dry finish.
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Botella 33 cl tomada en el Lupulo octubre 2014. (r382). Sabores intensos con un cuerpo intenso de 11 vol que se nota desde el principio. Original y bastante buena.

Mix of Evil Twin Yin and Evil Twin Yang. One long lasting explosion of fruits, molasses, chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. Really the best of both worlds. IPA kicks in first, then the Stout takes over, finishing in a mixture of both with quite some bitterness but also sweetness.
Next up are the seperate Yin and Yang. It's going to be a good evening.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle pours almost black in color with a 2 finger beige head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus and light roasted grains with some chocolate and hints of coffee. Taste is a roasted grain, coffee and citrus hop bitterness with a chocolate malty sweetness. Medium bodied with good carbonation that pleases the palate. Overall, a satisfying blend of 2 great beer styles that works well together.
Draft at Cask, Pimlico. Pours pitch black with beije foam. Expresso nose. Mouth has expresso and cocoa. It misses some depth with no fruit but it has a pleasant maltness.

Aroma: Roasty, rich hop-head

Appearance: Gray black colour and thin brown head

Taste: Heavy bitter and some malty sweet

Palate: Medium full body, slick oily texture, fizzy carbonation and the Aroma finishes

12oz bottle - pours an oily black with a very thin tan head. Solid roasty aroma with notes of burnt toast, coffee and subtle hops. Tasty and complex with layers of roasted grain, sweet coffee, more burnt toast and hints of bitter hops.

Bottle. Black body with a medium beige head. Light lacing. Aroma of blackcurrant, honey, plastic and chocolate. Flavour of tar, liquorice and coffee. Definitely doesnt taste as strong as 10% ABV. Medium body with a smooth texture. Soft fizz. Reminds me of Hopblack! by Dugges.

0,33l bottle at home. no BB date found. black color, small dark-coffee colored head. smells malty roast, earthy, licorice, some wood, creamy, very light grass notes. nice smell, not much black ipa though. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of cocoa, licorice, some roast, spices, earthy notes, very light citric, coffee, bitter chocolate. finishes dry, roasted and ligthly bitter with earthy notes and some licorice. good stuff, light notes from oxidation (but not in a bad way), not much hops on this one. overall very good. oxidation gets more apparent (and a bit more annyoing) once warmed up (-0.1)

Beautiful pitch black beer with a one finger high, beige head. 

This is awesome! Soft, tasty beer. Pine, grapefruit, roasted malt, chocolate, grass and licorice.

Der malzige Beginn ist von frischen Hopfenaromen durchzogen. Etwas herb, angedeutet alkoholisch, dann aber doch harmonisch mit verspielter Süße und Noten von Kaffe und Vanille mit grasigem Hintergrund. Weich, vollmundig, wahrscheinlich erheblich besser ausbalanciert, stünde es nicht seit 2 Jahren in meinem Keller. Gut! 10/11/8/11/10/11

On tap at The Singer pub in London. It was my daughters round and I asked her for something dark. This is what she got me; didnt realise it would be 10% though... In fairness, although it was clearly high in alcohol it really didnt taste anything like 10%. Dark and likable enough, I did however fail to notice a huge aroma or much in the way of distinctive flavours. Dont get me wrong, I mean its a good beer but does it really merit 99/100?!

Bottle 0.33l from Only good beer Budapest Hungary.Taste at Ramada Budapest 16.12.2015. Pour it dark color with small black head.Aroma chocolate, hoppy very nice .Taste dark chocolate, something sweet sugary in the middle, hoppy finish, really pleasent and great balanced.Smooth after taste nice one.

Keg at Craft Beer Co, Islington, London. A very dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty, hoppy aroma. Tastes roasty, malty, hoppy, bitter chocolate. Decent Black IPA.

Bottle @ Bier-Bier, Helsinki. Black color, tanned head. Nose has rich roasty malts, coffee, some fruity hoppy notes. Balanced full roasty body, coffee, licorice, hops at the end. Lenghty balanced finish.
Toda una experiencia en un porcentaje 80/20 blend, tanto visualmente como en aroma y gusto. Eso sí, sólo aconsejable para cerveceros experimentados capares de digerir cervezas muy alcohólicas.

Bottle - fuzzy dark brown to black coloured pour with a beige/tan head. Aroma and taste is a mix of roasted malts and tropical fruits, prominent hoppy, grapefruit, pine needles, some caramel, cocoa, roasted hoppy finish.
Keg at CBC Leather Lane. Big hoppy and roasty gangbang. Hides its booze exceptionally well. Dark fruity sweetness and bitter hop roast end.,
Van de tap @beertemple. Mooi zwart bier met cremekleurige schuimkraag. Aromas van gebrande mout en hop. Smaak is vooral gebrande mout en drop/salmiak. Voor mij een prachtige combi. Heerlijk bier

Bottle.

A- Spruce, pine, cigar smoke, lactose, dusty.

A- Dark brown color, dark liquid, beige head.

T- Pine, bitter, cream, dry cocoa.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Started with Yang then had this and next Ill have Yin. Maybe not the most logical order for the 3...or is it? Considering this is about 66% Yang and 33% Yin, the balance is still pretty even. It certainly is more IPA than stout but doesnt scream one or the other. Hard to detect and obvious standout flavors.

Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, booze, light pine, light IPA qualities. Appearance is dark dark brown, light brown head. Taste is sweet, roasted malt, some bitter hops, maybe lactose, coffee, a lot more stout than IPA. Mouthfeel is medium body with light carbonation, a bit of hops in the aftertaste. Overall, as a Black IPA, this is disappointing. Id say its more reminiscent of a hoppy porter. Still drinkable.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours black with tan head. 
Aroma pine, citrus, grapefruit, chocolate, caramel, coffee, roasted malts, more Yang. 
Taste chocolate caramel sweets, citrus grapefruit bitters. 
Mouthfeel oily. 
Great stuff.

Guiness meet my little friend the the double IPA.
This is a muddy alcoholic hop fest.
Very well balanced bitterness, like a guiness, with the same coffee notes, but super malty and alcoholic. Really like it!!
Aroma of citrus, roast, taste is bitter, roasty, warming from the alcohol which is definitely present.
Draft.(as old draft mixes dont count) Dark brown pour with tan head. Sweet malty aromas, herbal, fruit, earthy hop aromas. Weird sweet and malty, oxidation, herbal, fruit hop Flavors.

12 oz bottle at BOL in Vail. Nice twist ion traditional Black and Tan. Nice balance between IPA and stout roasted flavors. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(bottle) clear very dark brown colour with a medium tall brown head; aroma of stewed fruit, jam; smooth palate; balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish
An interesting combination of stout and IPA. Nothing sticks out, smooth taste. Not too bright.

Pours dark brown, almost black with light beige head. Aroma is roasted, nutty, fruity and licorice. Flavour is roasted, heavy bitter, medium sweet, licorice and bitttteeer. Nice but one bottle of this will be enough for every night. Very bitter stuff. Medium to heavy carbonation which is almost too much for this one.
Bottle from systembolaget sweden. Big and lasting brown head. Very dark color. Big roasted /Coffee aroma. Roasted taste and medium body.
Une IPA avec des goûts de café... Trop miam. Des notes de cuir, cest chaud même frais. trop bon.
Bottle from SB. Dark brown with a thick brown head. Malty and hoppy tones. Malt, fruit, coffee and hops. Full body with a long bitter / fruity finish.

Penetrating, floral, tangy aroma. The taste is roasty and hoppy, with the stout taking the lead despite it being just 1/3 of the mix. I wouldnt have guessed that this is a mix of 2 different releases, but it seems like something is just a little off, like it does whenever you blend beers. Big foamy head. A fair amount of coffee in the taste, and some acidity too. Good, but not a favorite.

Tan head dark brown pour near black soft medium carbonation aromas dark fruit caramel toffee chocolate dried and stone fruit citrus cocoa the flavours dark chocolate liquorice toffee caramel citrus medium bitter cocoa dried fruits peach grapefruit apricot grassy note plenty of good flavour the finish like the caramel sweetness is so good lasting bitter fruity taste a cracking ale

Bottle at home. Aroma is roasted malt, citrus, grapefruit, hops, chocolate, coffee, salmiak, pine resin. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet with a medium bitter finish. Body is above medium. Very smooth and easily drinkable, excellent blend of fruity IPA and roasty chocolate Stout. Delicous beer!
Bottle. Pours a grey generous head. Body is oily and pitch black. Nose is roasted malts , coffee. Taste is roasted malts and a little bit hoppy. Stout wins the IPA in flavor. Damn good beer.

Robe noire laissant diffuser de minces reflets acajou. Léger col de mousse couleur crème à la texture laiteuse et poreuse. Arômes de houblons nobles, malt caramelisé et légèrement rôti, beurre, pain grillé. Notes de résine et gazon. La ipa est mise de lavant. En bouche, beaucoup de houblons qui sont ensuite atténuées par des saveurs de rôtis. Orange, pamplemousse, gazon, un peu de résine de pin suivie par une transition vers un côté de pain grillé, chocolat noir et de malt rôti. Le tout dans une amertume de zestes dagrumes et cacao qui nous suit longuement. Texture légère à moyenne, corps moyennement rond. Haut taux dalcool imperceptible. Un bon hybride mais qui ne se démarque pas.

Home-Mix bottles. Lots of aroma of malt and hops. Roasty, coffee, melasses, chocolate - over-riped fruits, pine, grapefruit, bitter orange. The flavours starts very sweet and finish very bitter and dry. Lingering bitterness with notes of coffee. The body is full and the texture is creamy. Soft carbonation. The mix is better, more balanced and enjoyable than the two beers solo. Amazing.

Bottle - Black colour, medium, dense tan head, excellent retention and lacing. Intense roasted coffee aromas with a lot of dark chocolate, citrussy anx resinous hops. Taste of coffee, caramel, chocolate, cocoa powder, lemon zest, pine, grapefruit. Mediun body, average carbonation, silky texture, lingering roasted and hoppy aromas. Really nice marriage of a stout and an IPA.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours a deep brown with reddish tints around the edge and a finger of beige foam that lingers throughout. Citrusy nose with weed, coffee and caramel and cacao nibs. Medium body with average carbonation. Lots of pith and citrus zest on the front but finishes with dark cacao and coffee with a toasted caramel finish. Slighly sticky mouthfeel. Really good.

This is a beer blend, its 67% of Yang (Imperial IPA) and 33% of Yin (Imperial Stout). It pours black with a medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, resin and hops. Taste has coffee, fruit, caramel, dark malts. Smooth and medium bitter, quite hoppy in the palate. Perfect transgender ale.

12oz bottle - been meaning to try this one for a long time. When I smell this, I get coffee, resin and grapefruit. From the sip I get more of the same. ABV is well hidden at first. complex bitterness. long bitter finish. Ethers in the finish which overpower a semblance of booziness. also coffee roast flavors in the finish. Complex but not as sweet as I would expect.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are like a black IPA. Was hoping for more imperial stoutness to come out.

Combine two beers of about equal awesomeness and you somehow get something thats even more awesome than either is by itself. That convoluted sentence is courtesy of my blown mind. Its amazing how the combined flavors compliment each other. Somehow Yang brings out more of Yins chocolate and tobacco elements. Yin, on the other hand, enhances the dank cannabis notes in Yang. In a way, its wrong to focus on the individual beers in this blend since this beer has such lovely harmony but I cant help it after having each on their own. My head hurts. Ill just stop.

Aromas of roasted malts, coffee, and some chocolate with a citrus/ fruity hop presence. The flavor is about the same with the interplay between the roasted stout and IIPA flavors tussling about, its interesting and pretty decent, not something i would drink often though.

Pours a finger and a half of tan head on a black body.
The aroma has a strong citrus front with a roasted malt/chocolate background. Really nice.
The taste is lemon bitterness to start, then chocolate sweet mixed with coffee bitter, finishes with a slight citrus bitterness. 
The texture is crisp.
It has a great flavor profile.

On tap at Barrels & Bottles. Black appearance with a lacy, lingering tan head. Big roasted malt aroma with bitter chocolate, coffee, earthy hops, toasted grain, light pine and light grass. Similar flavor, fairly bitter and dry with hints of citrus zest and light herbal hops. Medium to full body. I like Yin (3.9) and Yang is OK (3.4) so this falls pretty much in the middle.

Took is as Yin&Yang bottle. Beer in the glass pours a very dark brown color with medium tan head. Aroma is really Black IPAish, hop forward, with tropical fruits and citrus and a coffee and chocolate base. Taste follows the aroma, again, grapefruit, pineapple and sweet citrus, with a very complementing Stout character, with coffee, chocolate and some molasses. Bitter aftertaste. Very drinkable to be a 10% ABV beer. Really nice.
Мы поедем, мы помчимс& на оленях утром ранним и отчаянн& ворвёмс& между стаутом и дипой.
33 cl systembolaget. En ok öl med lite av varje. Själv föredrar jag nog en Stout eller en ipa.

Bottle from web SB cons 2015-10-31 Göteborg
AR: heavy roasted malt, tar, tobaco, ash, 
AP: black, thin stouty sand brown lid
F: tar, heavy roasted malt, salt liqurice, dark and bitter chocolate, dry, warming feeling, wee grapefruit in the background / second thought too one diemensioned
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2015 Kolsvart med ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar mest som en tunn stout. Lite humle med rejäll beska. Rolig öl och ganska bra!

12 oz bottle. 139:15. From saveur-biere.com.
Dark reddish brown color with a mid-size grayish light brown head. 
Roasted malt, vanilla, dark hops, mild bitterness and fruity sweetness in the aroma. Balanced. 
The flavor is roasted malt, dryness, hops, moderate bitterness, licorice and fruit marmalade. Nice. Nice indeed. Mariage parfait.

Barwa czarna, piana ładna. Aromat to głównie chmiele: żywica, zielone cytrusy. W tle delikatna kawa i nuty palone. W smaku pełne, początkowo lekko słodkie z nutami gorzkiej czekolady i mocnej kawy w tle. Goryczka od początku wysoka, żywiczna z nutami tytoniowymi. Piwo pozostawia wytrawny posmak, palonego ziarna kawy.
Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Black with beige head. Sugary, nutty aroma, roasted chocolate, some piney hops. Full bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness.
355ml bottle. Pitch black body with a medium/low head. Aroma of wood, roasted malt, some citrus and gooseberries. Flavor has more IPA prescence in the beginning but finishes more stout like. Boozy.

Flaska från SB. En modern klassiker men första gången för mig. Massor av humle, tallskott, resin och grape i täten. En del rostade aromer men malten ihop med humlen skapar en doft och smakbild med en massa saltlakrits, vilket jag som tur är gillar men det blir ändå lite enkelspårigt...men gott.

Wunderbares Black IPA mit den gewohnten Strukturen und einer ebenso wundervoll balancierten Mitte aus Hopfen und Kaffee. Dabei recht würzig, etwas Zitrone, dazu leichte Süße selbst zum Ende hin. Gute Sache.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a deep black colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of hops, woods, pine and citrus fruits. Taste of hops, pine, woods, citrus fruits, chocolate and coffee. Hoppy-piney finish. Very quaffable and tasty, enjoyed it.

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a creamy beige, long lasting head, rich lacing. Roasted aroma, licorice and milk chocolate mixed with tropical fruit, banana, lychee and mango. Medium carbonated, creamy and smooth mouthfeel. Exciting taste fruity with guava and mango, simultaneously creamy and roasted notes, fudge, maple syrup, licorice and vanilla. Long warm finish, nice one!

Butelka bez daty. Ciemne z rubinem fajna piana. W zapachu troche ciemnych slodow troche rodzynek troszke zywicznych i kwiatowych chmieli. W smaku juz bardziej jak likierowate cda. Po ogrzaniu wychodzi alkohol. Piwo jest spoko w kategorii imperialne cda, podejrzewam ze jakbym mial swieze to dawalo by mocniej chmielem.

Bottle from Systembolaget.

Black with a large tan head. Aroma of hops, caramel and some licorice. Similar taste, also with light roasted malt. The mouthfeel was kind of creamy. A descent one.

12oz bottle. I have had Yin, I have had Yang...but guess I never rate this one. Solid hop character, I can see why it is categorized as a Black IPA. Rich and luscious chocolate tones, roasty bakers chocolate. A real monster of a Black IPA or hoppy Imperial Stout, but remains drinkable and enjoyable. Solid beer, a little dry and simplistic in the body at times though.

Taste is up in your face at first, a stingy almost peppery roasted bitter blackness that actually had me react for a second. A few sips in and when the beer warmed up a bit, you sense the IPA part better, with a lingering fruityness trying to break through. It never really breaks through, but it gives the beer a sort of fresh and almost creamy aftertaste. I like my beers rough and brutal, so this beer was right up my alley. I must try to get ahold of the Yin and try that one as a stand alone. Really liked this one.
Really smooth mix of IPA and stout. Light creamy head with a full dark body. Rich in flavor, well rounded with a lingering bitter aftertaste.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Hoppy smell with caramel and candy. Similar taste, some roasted aromas, dark malts, citrus, grape and pine. Vey nice. Love the hops and dark malts combo.

Piana beżowa, średnio obfita, opadając delikatnie zdobi szkło. Barwa ciemno brązowa, prawie czarna z rubinowymi przebłyskami. W aromacie królują cytrusy, likier cytrynowy, skórka curacao, odrobina iglaków i lukrecji, nuty palone oraz ciemne słody są bardziej z tyłu. W smaku piwo jest agresywne, od razu atakuje nas ostra alkoholowo-palona goryczka, gorzka czekolada, dojrzałe pomarańcze i żywica. W afterteasie przejrzałe mango i akcenty tytoniowe. Nagazowanie średnie, drobne i szczypiące, tekstura szorstka, goryczka wysoka do średniej, długo pozostająca, alkohol wyczuwalny, mocno rozgrzewający. 
Trunek okazał się nie lada wyzwaniem, wymagający nawet dla zaawansowanego piwosza. Przede wszystkim ponadprzeciętnie długa goryczka, wysoki alkohol i ziemistość, połączenie zapewne nie dla każdego. Ogólnie jednak całkiem dobre piwo, aromatycznie bliższe DIPA, smakowo American RIS z dodatkiem skórki pomarańczy - tak bym to podsumował.
Svart, brunt skum. Doft: Humle, malt, rostat, choklad, kola. Stark 7:a. Smak: Humle, malt, godis, kakao, grape, kola, rostat. Stark 7:a.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Black with a tan head. 
Sweetish aroma with http://www.gp.set hay and liquorice. 
A bit vinous. 
Mor sweet liquorice in the flavour. Medium to high bitterness.
Bottle from SB. Almost black with medium head. Hoppy aroma & taste. Wonderful beer! Great mix of DIPA & Stout.
Citric, resinous, roasty, licorice, sweetened coffee, alcohol. Black colour, medium head.
Flaska från SB. Svart med beige skum. Choklad och frukt i doften. Choklad och portvin i smaken.
Beer tasting @ fillepolo 2/10-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Hoppy, fruity and roasted. Body is medium, the finish is dry, bitter and roasted with some chocolate.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a dark Brown colour beer. Roasted malts with notes of fruit and hops. Finish is dry with a touch of chocolate
Beer tasting @ fillepolo 151002. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Hoppy and fruity with roasted notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and roasted with hoppy notes.

Flaska systembolaget. Mörkbrun vätska med ett ganska fluffigt beiget skum. Frisk och lätt fruktig doft med barr, fuktigt hö och choklad. Rostad slutkläm. 
Maltig smak med lite kärv munkänsla. Kaffe, trä, barr rålakrits och lite alkohol. Ganska bitter.

A fun and great mix of two great brews. 
You can really nose and taste both of the different kinds of beer. 
This is great!

Bottle from Biervana 
roasty, coffee, chocolate, spruce, citrus, black, hazy, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, very bitter, full body, oily feel, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, bitter,
Self made from Yin and Yang taps at Erzbierschof Zurich. The beer mix keeps its Yin nose, but also gets the Yang punch. A nice mix, but in this way, it has not much resemblance with a BIPA.

Dark brown colour with beige head on top and small lacing. Aroma has licorice, roasted malts, grapefruit bitterness and ending with herbs and grass. Taste is roasted, and there is a lot of herbs. Licorice and bitter grapefruit pop up in the after taste. Grass and coffee is also there. Full body and medium carbonation. Great Black IPA.
Mixing the unmixing. Great beer. Balanced. Very delicious and hoppy and "stouty"!!! Great!!!
Pitch black color with nice lasting light brown head. Aroma is hops, bit roasted. Flavor is hops, roasted, liquorice.
dark brown colour, minimal beige head; aroma chocolate, herbal liqueur and dried fruity notes, taste of roasted coffee, chocolate and herbal liqueur; excellent black IPA

Wygląd: Ciemnobrunatne w zasadzie czarne w szkle. Piana średnioobfita, beżowa, zwłaszcza drobnopęcherzykowa. Średniotrwała i lekko znaczy szkło,..
Aromat: Ciemne pieczywo, alkohol, żywica, melasa, czekolada, trochę paloności, trochę estrów w tym gumy balonowej, dojrzale owoce (z chmielu) 
Odczucie: oleiste, średniowysycone, ciało powyżej średniego-wysokie
Smak: Palone, czekoladowe, sporo słodyczy, chmielu w smaku trochę jest ale bliżej temu do RISa. Goryczka wysoka i grejpfrutowa i palona i wzmocniona alkoholem, który jest dość mocno zaznaczony, lekko piekący. Posmak kawowo-czekoladowy.
Całość: CIekawe połączenie ale z drugiej strony nie wiadomo co z tym robić, leżakować żeby alkohol się lepiej ułożył koszterm chmielu czy pić świeże z uwagi na sporą zawartość IPA.
Raczej lepiej pić je z osobna Świeżą IPę i wyleżakowanego RISa

Pours black with a medium frothy mocha head. Aromas of chocolate, peach, apricot, grapefruit, roasted malts, brown sugar. Taste is chocolate, peach, apricot, roasted malts, citrus. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Aromat: coś na kształt Black IPA, choć może z większym wpływem stoutu.Jest czekolada gorzka, kakao, kawa, paloność, lukrecja, alkohol i owocowy oraz leśny chmiel. Ogólnie słodko i całkiem przyjemnie.


Wygląd: barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, dość obfita i trwała. 


Smak: spora słodycz, ale i kwaskowość, z dość szybką chmielową kontrą i wyraźną nutą alkoholową. W tle czekolada, likier, wiśnie w likierze, kakao, kawa, paloność. Goryczka chmielowa wysoka (wsparta przez ciemne słody i alkohol), szczypiąca i dosyć długa, ale przyjemna. Tęga pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie i palony oraz alkoholowy (rozgrzewający przełyk) finisz. Nieco oleista konsystencja.


Całkiem udany kupaż, choć miałem nadzieję na bardziej chmielowy charakter. Do tego alkohol, jak dla mnie nieco zbyt wyczuwalny.

W aromacie początkowo prym wiedzie nuta chmielowa (żywiczno-cytrusowa), po chwili dopiero zaczyna się przedzierać lekka paloność, czekolada i nuty tiramisu. W smaku jest mocno goryczkowo, za natychmiastową kontrą pod postacią czekolady i paloności. Momentami wyczuwalne aromaty kukułki. Alkohol dość potężnie ogrzewa bebechy, ale w szlachetny sposób. Całość dość wytrawna, wysycenie średnia. Ciekawy eksperyment.
Botte from Biercab Shop. Black colour with brown head. Hoppy, citric, juice, chocolate and roasted aroma. Sweet, hoppy, juice, fruity, chocolate taste. Medium to full body.

12fl oz bottle at home from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Body is black, head is small, brownish, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Nose is bonbon, flavor is cocoa, truffle, coffee, mocha, dark fruits, spices. Light sweet, heavy roasty bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty and hoppy extra heavy bitter, tons of dark chocolate, quinine, light alcohol warmth. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Quite heavy due to bitterness, very tasty, excellent dessert beer.

Bottle. Teku. Deep blacj with light brown, densed head. Medicore lacing and head retention. Aroem is like dissolved roasted malts - some light coffee, dark chocolate and some dark fruits - plums. In teh background some citrus and floral hops aromas. Taste is high bitter with some strong acidic coffee accents. Medium to full body, medium to lively carbonation, oily texture, finish is high bitter and semi-dry. Definetely for bitterness lovers - nice combination.

Bottle. Almost black. The aroma is sweet roasted malt with sticky pine and herbal/fruity hops. The taste follows and adds a bitter, sweet, and boozy finish. A very interesting and nicely done concept. All the different stout and ipa characteristics are individually noticeable but, the beer is balanced overall. --- Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
355ml bottle. Blown away by the scores here. This is okay, certainly not a black ipa, really just a strong stout with i guess some hoppiness in there.

Mix of Yin and Yang
Pours dark dark brown with low off white head
Aromas of dark bread, dark fruits, roasted malts, , coffee powder
Taste has nice notes of ash, dark bread, tropical fruits, roasted malts
Medium sweet, bitter, carbonation and body
Draught. Almost black, bit transparent with creamy head. Aroma of floral and tropical fruits with roastiness. In taste sweet, hoppy, lightly roasty. Full bodied, smooth. Nice.

Aroma is more dominated by floral, herbal hops, with slight molasses aromas from Yin. Flavors are really interesting, oscillating back and forth between the lighter and darker flavors of Yin and Yang, but linked together by a pervading bitterness. Really good.

Dark but rather transparent, with a tan medium creamy head. Hoppy, roasted, bitter orange aromas. On palate dry and bitter roasted, some orange peel, malty bready. Finish is very sweet, with a sour red fruit-prune taste, and lightly boozy. A bit awkward.

Bottle, pours black with a beige head. Aroma: roast, tropical fruit, liquorice. Taste: liquorice, pine, tropical fruit, chocolate, orange, spices. Medium sweet, medium to high bitter, creamy texture, medium body, lively carbonation.
Poured deep dark brown, frothy beige head. Aroma of sweet chocolate and toffee, quite muted. Medium to full body, flavour as the aroma, sweet and dry, moderately bitter.

Bottle from bierkoning, amsterdam. Black color, tanned head. Aroma has rich roasty malts, coffee, some fruity hoppy notes. Balanced full roasty body, coffee, licorice, hops at the end. Nice and tasty ipaish stout.

Bottle, shared by me... in my dining room... just now.
Pours a very dark brown with a huge fluffy khaki head with some lacing on da glass.

The aroma is mildly sweet with some chocolate and some herbal on fruity hop character. Its got a touch of booze & some prune...but its chill. 

The flavor is bitter enough to be labeled bracing but far from astringent, & sweet enough but far from unbalanced or cloying. Its certainly tipped towards the Hoppier end with a big fruity & leafy hop presence with a lingering herbal bitterness. In fact the bitterness seems decidedly more hop driven than malt driven... there is a decent enough bit of roast and even a lingering sort of espresso character to it. Its got some dark chocolate as well. Maybe because Im expecting the stout characteristics I dont mind them so much, but its funny... I normally reject big roastiness in a Black IPA (not to say that this is strictly such) but yeah somehow this seems to balance better than your typical roast heavy black IPA. 

cool

On tap at Beertemple. Black with a beige head. Aroma of hops, chocolate, licorice, coffee. Taste is bitter sweet, hoppy, roasted malts, chocolate, licorice, bitter hoppy aftertaste with hints of chocolate. Nice.

Black with small sudsy light beige head. Aroma has chocolate, some licorice and hoppy notes. Similar flavour, big mouthfeel with strong bitter bite. Woody and fruity notes later on. Semi sticky with lasting strong coffee and piney bitterness. Good one.

Hazy light brown colour (EBC ~25) with a small tan head. Aromas of tropical fruit, pine and a good dose of roasted chocolatey malts arise with hints of citrus peel, and faint milk coffee. Fine carbonation, medium slick with a full body. Fruity malt centered sweetness with phenolic astringency and fruity hoppy bitterness. Lasting bit astringent finish. Good balance and interesting, yet potent.

A Yin e a Yang eram muito gostosas. Estava curioso pra saber a mistura de ambas. É uma excelente cerveja. A Yin prevaleceu muito sobre a Yang apesar da porcentagem desta ser bem maior (67%). Espuma consistente e sabor equilibrado com alcool perceptível. A Yin é levemente superior à versão combinada.

Very interesting beer I sampled at World of Beer Fest, Milwaukee. Hits you with some coffee and pine flavor and finishes with a bit of hoppy bite. Not one I would drink every day but nice for a small sample.

Bottle. Dark brown close to black with a large beige head. Nose has dark malts; licorice, chocolate and some citrusy and floral hops. Flavour has a nice balance between malt and hos; roasted malt, licorice, cocoa, wood with crisp citrus. Medium/full body, fine carbonation, medium sweet and bitter, warming alcohol. Long dry finish with fruity hops. Drinks pretty well.

From old notes. From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Dark brown color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, caramel, chocolate, hoppy, pine, grassy. Sweet and biter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Moderate dark bread and toasted cereal for the malt, light to moderate resin for the hops, light broth for the yeast, with faint notes of caraway and dried salami. Head is small, frothy, light brown with good lacing and good legs and is mostly diminishing. Color is clear very dark brown. Flavor starts lightly to moderately sweet and acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and moderately bitter. Palate is medium to full, creamy, with a soft to lively carbonation. A nice mix of dark and toasty , and sharp and piney in this Black IPA.
Tap. Dark pour. Pine, roast, coffee, citrus. Nice balance of bitter, citrus and roast.

Piana obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, całkiem trwała, zwarta. Lacing świetny.
Barwa czarna z lekkimi ciemnymi rubinowymi prześwitami. Przepiękne bąbelki które można było zaobserwować jak goniły pianę.

Aromat coś niesamowitego, połączenie palonych, kawowo czekoladowych nut z niesamowitymi chmielami. Dyzo cytrusów i iglasto sosnowych klimatów.

W smaku słodowe, czekoladowo karmelowe, a później do akcji wkraczają chmiele i robi się grejpfrutowo i sosnowo.

Wysycenie średnie, pełne, z naprawdę konkretną sosnowo iglastą goryczką.

330ml bottle (Zmogsala 2015, Vilnius) (7+:4:7+:4:15=3.7++)
Lovely balance. Great roast, lovely hops. Good offee and treacle. Finish bitter. Damn good.

12 oz bottle poured into a snifter. Black with a finger of light tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, roast, pine, coffee. Tastes of roast, coffee, dark chocolate, some pine, caramel. Medium body with a dry finish. Nice blend.
On tap. Dark brown colour. Roasted citrus hops aroma. Sweet, chocolate, citrus hops flavour, butter finish

On tap @ legnano brauhaus. Marrone scuro, velato, schiuma beige fine mediamente persistente.Aroma tostato, di cioccolato fondente, fruttato, di frutta secca (nocciola). Decent brew, like most of this brewery. Im a fan of "Black IPA" mostly, and this one is a decent beer in that style for sure.

Dark brown, almost black color. Some coffee and hops in the aroma. Full body, taste - coffee, chocolate with bitter, hoppy finish.

Getting a lot more stout than IPA in the taste. To be honest I get a lot more quad than stout in the aromas (boiled sweets). Cant find a label that fits for this beer but its interesting. Palate is very velvety and laaaaaasting bitterness !

Bottle at WilliamK. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with coffee, hops, roasted malts, nuts, licorice and dark fruits. Bitter finish with coffee, licorice, hops, nuts and a bit chocolate. Excellent brew.
Pitch black with large head. Limited aroma, mostly chocolate with some vanilla. Chocolate taste with some liquorish aftertaste. Warm alcohol finish.

Its perfectly clear, dark copper color, with beautiful head. Very nice aroma of dark malts, but yet its so fresh and lite. Its the same history in the taste. IPA start, CDA finish and huge stout in aftertaste. Its a bomb of flavours and aromas. Huge and awesome beer.

Beczka 0,2 l, Zaklęte Rewiry, Wrocław. Aromat: palony, czekoladowy z amerykańskim chmielem (jakieś cytrusy i sosna). Piana beżowa, dość obfita i trwała. Ładnie zdobi szkło. Smak: podobnie jak w aromacie. Słodkie, z wyraźną goryczką. Tekstura gęsta, wysycenie niskie.

Rich deep dark brown coloured body with a thinnish tan head that fades very fast. Aroma of a surprisingly nice mix of super hoppy resinous notes and a very roasted, coffee scent with malt front and centre. Full-bodied; Strong roasty flavours with vanilla, oak and chocolate the most noticeable, but the bitter hop flavours show through as well with a good citrus and piney bite near the end. Aftertaste shows a deep robust chocolate and coffee flavour of malts with a good hop flavour as well - a surprisingly nice balance, even though its strong on both fronts. Overall, a nice beer, especially for the price - good to try, but not worth searching out for. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased a few hours ago from Southern Season in Charleston, South Carolina on 19-April-2015 for US$3,19 sampled in my hotel room in Charleston, South Carolina a few hours later on 19-April-2015.

Bottle: Poured a dark black with a light mocha color head and gentle lace along the edges of the glass. It has a dark roasted coffee aroma with a strong coffee, coca and a hoppy taste. There is a thick creamy mouth feel along with a good amount of bitterness at the end.
On tap. Black with a nice beige head. Coffee aroma. Coffee, pine, dark fruit taste. This is excellent. I love this beer.

12 oz. bottle from Wilburs. Appearance: finger chocolate head, good lacing, brown, clear to opaque. Aroma: chocolate, light toast, molasses, floral. Palate: full body, average carbonation, sticky texture, bitter finish. Taste: sweet chocolate and caramel, with floral and pine hops boiling up and destroying the palate on the back end, super bitter finish. Overall, amazing! super good combination, very good beer.

Black colour with quite nice head. Aroma in the beginning is typical for imperial stout, so weve got roastness, coffee, chocolate, sweetness and lately there is hoppy strike. In taste firstly is sweetness, roastness, dried fruits and finish is also typical for double ipa with some hops.

Deep black pour with a foamy light tan head. Nice rich dark aroma of rich deep cocoa, roasted coffee tones, a touch of imperial stout-y licorice, and a little bitter hoppy leafiness. Big bold flavor full of imperial stout tones and big IPA flavors of grapefruity piney earthy hoppy bitterness all over the place...but the beginning, as well as the base of the flavor is rooted in earthy roasty sweet black malt, a kiss of molasses/licorice, and a wee kiss of coffee. Huge flavor, not astringent, very complex and nuanced. Theres something different in every sip.

Bottle.

Aroma is moderately malty (roasted grain, dark chocolate), moderately to heavily hoppy (resin, grapefruit), lightly yeasty (dough), with a note of alcohol, light note of vanilla.

I never tried Yang, since...well...Danish IIPA, right? Gonna be a resin bomb. But I enjoyed Yin a fair bit so I figured Id see how this one fared. text: From bottle. For my taste it is more imperial stout with a bitter finish, but overall, very nice and solid brew.

12 fl. oz. bottle bought at Grebhan´s, Bremen. Pours out black. Tanned one finger head. Choco and dark berriefruity on the nose. Such a nice experience !

Bottle. Inky black with large cramy tan head, roasted malt aroma, low carbonation, starts with a mocha taste and ends with a bitter long finish. The hops aroma is all but lost beneath the mocha. Such an intesting brew from Evil Twin again!

On tap at the Bull & Bush. Pours dark brown with head and lace. aroma of grains and dark malts. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of dark roasted malts, dark chocolate, grains, hops. Overall rich, bold, and a bit bitter.

Draught. Pours dark brown in color with a tan head. Roasted notes upfront, some chocolate and fruity citrus notes in aroma. Some burnt notes are apparent as well. Notes of oranges and dark chocolate in taste.. Theres a nice bitterness present here too. Quite dry. Some nutty and piney notes in aftertaste.
